title: Nanotechnology Exploration Project: Undergraduate Research Experience Program (Social Science Approach)

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic science (physics/chemistry) and engineering concepts, as well as foundational social science research methodologies (research design, data collection, etc.)
context.additional_context: Analyzing experimental data and using collaboration tools via digital devices (tablets/laptops). Focus on exploring how technological advancements impact social institutions, civic rights, and cultural relationships.

learning_goals: Perform step-by-step synthesis and characterization experiments of nanomaterials while developing critical thinking about the interaction between science/technology and society.
Explain the basic operating principles of nano-measurement equipment (e.g., SEM) and analyze the impact of technological advancements on economic and cultural contexts.

Over four weeks, learners collect social impact data using ≥3 methods (surveys, interviews, observations) in team-based research projects, perform basic statistical analysis with SPSS/R/Python, and collaboratively write a ≥5-page APA-formatted research report with team members.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
